Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Set/Intersection
Synopsis Intersection of two sets.
Syntax Exp1 & Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 & Exp2
set[T1] set[T2] set[lub(T1,T2)]
Description Returns the intersection of the two set values of Exp1 and Exp2.
Examples 
rascal>{1, 2, 3, 4, 5} & {4, 5, 6};
set[int]: {5,4}

Questions
Question [1]. When you compute the intersection of two sets, the number of elements in the result is always:




Question [2].
The type of {"Elmo", "Oregano", "Musterd"} & {"Cookie Monster"} is

Question [3].
The type of {true} & {true, false} is

Question [4]. 
{"C", "Little Bird", "Raspberry", "C", "Bruno"} & {"S"} ==
